alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 11:59AM MST until July 25 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 130 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1155 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated that the initial round of heavy rain has moved to the west, but additional showers and thunderstorms are forming and will likely continue to impact the area. Doppler radar estimates that between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prescott, Prescott Valley, Wilhoit, Iron Springs, Skull Valley, Indian Hill West Prescott, Ponderosa Park, Yavapai Campground, Downtown Prescott, Kirkland, Oak Knoll Village, Groom Creek Subdivision, Prescott Gateway Mall, Walker, White Spar Campground, Lower Wolf Creek Campground, Upper Wolf Creek Group Campground and Lynx Lake Dam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
